item.title: Senior Advisor - EDF/Expert in EU Development Assistance
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to support SADC Secretariat on EU Development Cooperation

Global objective

The objective of this assignment is to strengthen the SADC-EU cooperation relationship and to effectively contribute to SADC’s engagement with the European Union to enhance implementation of the revised Regional Indicative Strategic Development Plan (RISDP).

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives of the assignment include the following:-

  • Engage with SADC Secretariat to provide speedy, effective and efficient quality policy reactions and strategic guidance concerning the preparation and implementation of EU financed programmes;
  • Engage with SADC Secretariat to enhance the policy dialogue with the EU, especially in relation to programming and implementation of co-operation programmes;
  • Engage with SADC Secretariat to enhance resource mobilization through effective use of EU instruments, regional funding initiatives and development bank financing modalities;
  • Engage with SADC Secretariat to oversee the implementation of EU-funded and supported programmes;
  • Engage with SADC Secretariat to strengthen SADC visibility and corporate image with the EU, through improved corporate and thematic visibility and communication strategic interventions at regional and international platforms.

Senior Advisor – EDF

Minimum requirements:

  • Preferably a Master’s Degree in the field of Political Science, Law, Economics,Development Studies or other related studies. OR in the absence of a formal Master’s Degree in the required field: relevant work experience of at least 10 years;
  • At least 6 years of professional experience in the area of EU development assistance and/or any other relevant field.

Specific requirements:

  • Have proven working experience in drafting strategy documents, preferably in an EU or regional integration context;
  • Have proven working experience in establishing and conducting multi-stakeholder coordination and/or policy dialogues.
  • Have proven work experience in the area of management of the EU development financial resources.
  • Have proven previous experience in dealing with EDF rules and procedures, as well as EU financial instruments.
  • Proven experience in dealing with Regional Economic Communities (RECs) within the African Context constitutes an advantage.

Other requirements:

  • Fluency in written and spoken English;
  • Excellent communication and analytical skills;
  • Sound knowledge of regional integration policies and strategies;
  • Proven working experience in the SADC region is an asset;
  • Ability to communicate in French or Portuguese is an asset.

item.title: Chef de Mission, Expert dans le domaine du Génie Civil
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Audit technique de projet d'assainissement et de restructuration urbaine de Hann et Petit Mbao

Objectifs généraux

L'objectif général du projet dont ce marché fait partie est de contribuer à l'amélioration du cadre et des conditions de vie des populations des quartiers de Hann Village et de Petit Mbao par la rationalisation du tissu urbain, la réduction de l'insalubrité, la facilitation de l'accès par toutes les catégories de population aux services publics de base et la stimulation de l'économie locale.

Objectif(s) particulier(s)

La mission qui sera confiée à l'auditeur consiste à assurer le Maître d'Ouvrage et l'Union européenne:

  • du bon déroulement des travaux exécutés dans le cadre du projet d'Assainissement et de Restructuration Urbaine de Hann et Petit Mbao et de leur surveillance,
  • de la conformité des prestations avec les dispositions de la convention de financement et des contrats signés,
  • de la bonne organisation du chantier, du respect des règles contractuelles et des règles de l'art dans la construction routière,
  • de la qualité technique des réalisations et des dépenses effectuées,
  • de la bonne gestion contractuelle des marchés en vérifiant si chaque intervenant souscrit correctement à ses obligations, et ceci afin de diminuer à caractère préventif le risque de réclamation, litige et/ou contentieux.

Le titulaire a l'obligation de signaler toute anomalie qui affecterait ou pourrait affecter ces objectifs et de faire les recommandations correspondantes pour les prévenir ou pour y remédier. Il doit être totalement indépendant des attributaires des contrats de travaux et de surveillance ainsi que de tout intérêt particulier dans l'Etat du Maître d'Ouvrage qui pourrait compromettre son indépendance.

Expert catégorie l, Chef de Mission

Chef de mission catégorie et durée de l'expérience équivalente Expert de catégorie I

*Formation *:

L'expert aura un diplôme d'ingénieur dans le domaine du génie civil ou équivalent, ou ayant exercé des fonctions similaires pendant 15 ans.

Expérience

  • L'expert devra avoir une expérience minimale de 12 ans dans la réalisation, le contrôle de projets de construction routière, et/ou d'adduction dteau et d'assainissement, et/ou d'aménagement urbain.

  • L'expert devra avoir réalisé au moins un projet en qualité de chef de mission de contrôle d'un projet équivalent (construction routière, ou adduction d'eau et assainissement, ou aménagement urbain), et réalisé au moins un audit technique sur un projet équivalent (construction routière, ou adduction d'eau et assainissement, ou aménagement urbain).

  • L'expert devra avoir une bonne connaissance des procédures relatives aux marchés de travaux financés par le Fonds Européen de Développement.

Expérience constituant un avantage

  • Expérience sur des projets d'aménagement et/ou de restructuration urbaine

  • Expérience gestion de contentieux dans le cadre de marchés de travaux routiers, génie civile et/ou aménagement urbain (analyse de réclamations)

  • Expérience dans le cadre d'activités d'Informations, d'Education et de Communication de projet

  • Expérience en Afrique subsaharienne

Connaissances linguistiques

L'expert aura une excellente maitrise orale et écrite de la langue française.

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Global objective

The overall objective of the project of which this contract will be a part is as follows:

  • To contribute towards building a capable state, responsive to the needs of all its citizens and the promotion of national interest, accountability and transparency in service delivery, and utilising public resources in an effective and efficient way.

Specific objectives

The service provider shall achieve the following specific objectives (SOs) for this assignment:

  • SO 1 - Undertake an evaluation of the current cost-recovery, revenue generation and funding model in order to determine its effectiveness, cost-efficiency, cost-recovery, competitiveness and growth potential as well as other key considerations outlined in Section 2.3, within the public sector environment.

  • SO 3 Provide recommendations for modification and improvement of the NSG business and funding model in order to promote sustainability and financial viability of the organization

item.title: Key expert 5: Expert for Tourism; Category I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project:

GLOBAL OBJECTIVE To contribute to the Government of Uganda’s successful completion of the Mid-Term Review (MTR) of the 2nd National Development Plan (NDP2) and the end evaluation of the 1st National Development Plan (NDP-1).

SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES

  • To assess progress made against the NDP-1 and NDP-2 objectives in the thematic areas of Infrastructure (1), Employment (2) Industrialization and Value Addition (3), Minerals, Oil and Gas (4) and Tourism (5).
  • To identify evidence-based, justified and detailed short-term (NDP-2), medium-term (NDP-3) and long-term (10 years NDP) adjustments and actions.

REQUESTED SERVICES

The Consultants’ services will indicatively include but not necessarily be limited to the following:

GENERAL SERVICES

  • Validate or update the specific organization & methodology, including work-plan, during the inception phase.
  • Identify, review and analyse reference documents that are relevant to the NDP2 MTR and the NDP1 end evaluation.
  • Undertake fieldwork to collect data and carry out data analysis to inform the respective assessment.
  • Conduct meetings with key stakeholders at various levels.
  • Conduct consultation and validation workshops to inform the outputs of the assignment.
  • Prepare an inception report
  • Prepare for each (5) thematic area a main report and a synthesis report.
  • Participate and take a leading role in the Government of Uganda’s dissemination conference(s) of the final reports
  • Establish a web-based repository of working documents to allow NPA to monitor timely progress made against the assignment’s outputs.

SPECIFIC SERVICES

  • Analyse for each of the 4 thematic areas outlined in chapter 2.2 the (a) current situation, (b) progress made against the NDP targets and © public and private financing against NDP projections.
  • Conduct for each thematic area an inventory (status) of public investment projects implemented during NDP.
  • Assess community-level experiences and perceptions.
  • Analyse for each thematic area main drivers and opportunities.
  • Identify for each thematic area the factors that have proved critical or hindered progress under both NDP-1 and NDP-2.
  • Assess for each thematic area the extent to which NDP-1 and NDP-2 have guided policies, strategic planning, budgeting and actions.
  • Assess for each thematic area the impacts (positive and negative) of policy, planning and budget actions under the NDP-1 and NDP-2 periods.
  • Assess the institutional functions linked with each thematic area under a programme-based planning and budgeting approach and provide the necessary adjustments to facilitate and enhance compliance between the NDP and the programme-based approaches. Apply for each thematic area the applicable OECD DAC Evaluation Criteria to NDP-1 and NDP-2.
  • Assess the efficiency, effectiveness and sustainability of the implementation and mechanisms for each thematic area under both the NDP-1 and the NDP-2 and outline the necessary improvements.
  • Analyse for each thematic area lessons learned during the NDP implementation.
  • Identify for each thematic area international best practices relevant to Uganda.
  • Identify and justify for each thematic area priority lessons learned and recommendations for the medium- (NDP-3) and long-term (10-year) NDP.
  • Provide for each thematic area evidence-/best practices-based guidance on alternative policies, strategic priorities and actions to achieve better results within Uganda’s setting.
  • Provide for each thematic area medium-term (2020/21-2024/25) and long-term (2020/21- 2029/30) estimates of required results and indicative budget requirements.

Experience and Qualifications required

Qualifications and skills

Minimum requirements

  • Advanced University degree (Master’s degree or equivalent) in tourism, business administration, economics, private sector development or any other closely related subject.
  • Excellent English communication and writing skills (C-2 level proficiency).

Preferred requirements

  • PhD degree

General professional experience

Minimum requirements

  • At least 12 years of successful international working experience with the sustainable development of the tourism sector.

Specific professional experience

Minimum requirements

  • Profound international working experience with evaluating national or sector-level strategies and investment plans for tourism development.

Preferred requirements

  • Profound knowledge of the state of the tourism sector in Uganda.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

item.title: NGO Policy Review Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
External Review of the National NGO Policy of the Republic of Botswana

Global objective

The overall objective is to contribute to enhancing the partnership between Government and CSOs to achieve national development goals as set in the NDP11 and Vision 2036. The aim is to develop a more strategic and accountable framework for CSOs – Government relations, characterised by an effective participation of CSOs in the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of development policy, while safeguarding independence and autonomy of CSOs.

Specific objective(s)

More specifically, the purpose of the assignment is to undertake an external assessment of the Botswana National NGO Policy and provide inputs into its review. According to the same NGO Policy, the review should take place after five years of implementation, that is April 2018.

The NGO Policy review is fundamental to develop a long-term strategic framework to strengthening civil society and promote effective and accountable partnership between CSOs and Government, aligning and integrating it with NDP11 and Vision 2036. The review should allow the NGO Policy to be updated and adapted to the changed context and emerging priorities of civil society. In particular, the review of the NGO Policy shall be informed by the findings and recommendations of an external assessment of the implementation of the past five years, looking in particular at the following aspects:

  • The relevance of the strategic framework of the NGO Policy to the evolving context of civil society and CSOs - government relations, the NDP11 and Vision 2036;
  • The adequacy of the current framework for civil society participation and engagement in policy dialogue, looking at the experiences of the Technical Working Groups and the Stakeholders Forum, in view of improving spaces and mechanism of dialogue, integrating effective CSOs participation into the national development planning system
  • The legitimacy and credibility of CSOs and the capacity of the CSO networks to enhance and channel the voice of citizens and disadvantaged groups;
  • The institutional set up of the NGO Policy, identifying the adequate parent ministry and linkages to relevant LMs to promote the goals of the policy;
  • The implementation mechanisms and coordination of the NGO Policy in view of making them more strategic, practical, effective and accountable;
  • The monitoring and evaluation system for the NGO Policy.

NGO Policy Review Expert

Minimum requirements:

  • Master’s Degree in law, international law, public policy, political sciences or other relevant field OR in the absence of a formal Master’s Degree in the required field: relevant work experience of at least 10 years;
  • At least 6 years of professional experience in the area of strengthening of civil society.

Specific requirements:

  • Participation in at least 3 evaluations, concerning national civil society assessments and/or review of policy relevant to CSOs; Proven professional experience in design of CSO policy frameworks;
  • Extensive knowledge of NGO policy international best practices and wide expertise on issues related to CSOs, policy dialogue and enabling environment as demonstrated by relevant research, publications and reports;
  • Demonstrable working experience in CSO sectors in Africa (experience in countries of Southern Africa shall be considered an added advantage);
  • Fluency in oral and written English is compulsory.

All experts must be independent and free from conflicts of interest in the responsibilities they take on.

item.title: Expert in Teacher Education
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of Improving Secondary Education in Malawi (ISEM) Programme

The programme to be evaluated

Programme: Improving Secondary Education in Malawi (ISEM). Cris no. 2015/037-756

In response to the above challenges, secondary education was identified as one of the main focal areas under the 11th EDF National Indicative Programme (NIP) for the period 2014 to 2020 for support in order to contribute towards the achievement of Malawi’s socio-economic development goals. A Financing Agreement for ISEM was signed with the Government of Malawi on 20th October 2015, and implementation commenced in August 2016.

ISEM provides a comprehensive range of supports to the secondary sub-sector by responding to:

  • Increasing access through rehabilitation and expansion of infrastructure, mainly in Community Day Secondary Schools, and provision of bursaries for girls and vulnerable students;
  • Quality and relevance needs through the provision of teacher training support and the provision of teaching and learning materials to schools, and support to the rollout of the entire Secondary Curriculum;
  • Governance needs through support to capacity building and Decentralization of the secondary sub-sector.

In addition, technical workshops in 12 secondary schools (wood work, metal work and technical drawing) will be rehabilitated and equipped in order to render them functional again. The objective of this is to enhance the technical skills of secondary students and provide linkages to the similar developments in training for the construction sector being supported by a sister EU project on Skills and Technical Education Programme (STEP).

Global objective

The global objective of this assignment is to conduct a Mid-term evaluation of the ISEM Programme in order to measure the achievement to-date against the programme indicators in all the implementation areas (as per its logical framework).

Specific Objectives

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of the programme in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches. From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Mid-term Evaluation of Improving Secondary Education in Malawi (ISEM) Programme

The programme to be evaluated

Programme: Improving Secondary Education in Malawi (ISEM). Cris no. 2015/037-756

In response to the above challenges, secondary education was identified as one of the main focal areas under the 11th EDF National Indicative Programme (NIP) for the period 2014 to 2020 for support in order to contribute towards the achievement of Malawi’s socio-economic development goals. A Financing Agreement for ISEM was signed with the Government of Malawi on 20th October 2015, and implementation commenced in August 2016.

ISEM provides a comprehensive range of supports to the secondary sub-sector by responding to:

  • Increasing access through rehabilitation and expansion of infrastructure, mainly in Community Day Secondary Schools, and provision of bursaries for girls and vulnerable students;
  • Quality and relevance needs through the provision of teacher training support and the provision of teaching and learning materials to schools, and support to the rollout of the entire Secondary Curriculum;
  • Governance needs through support to capacity building and Decentralization of the secondary sub-sector.

In addition, technical workshops in 12 secondary schools (wood work, metal work and technical drawing) will be rehabilitated and equipped in order to render them functional again. The objective of this is to enhance the technical skills of secondary students and provide linkages to the similar developments in training for the construction sector being supported by a sister EU project on Skills and Technical Education Programme (STEP).

Global objective

The global objective of this assignment is to conduct a Mid-term evaluation of the ISEM Programme in order to measure the achievement to-date against the programme indicators in all the implementation areas (as per its logical framework).

Specific Objectives

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of the programme in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches. From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

The evaluation should provide an understanding of the cause and effects links between inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision-making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the programme stakeholder and general public with:

  • An overall assessment of the performance of ISEM
  • Key lessons learned and recommendations in order to improve the programme and any future programmes.

In particular, this evaluation will serve to understand the performance of the Action, its enabling factors and those hampering a proper delivery of results in order to adjust its design or implementing modalities and to inform the planning of the future EU interventions and Actions in the same sector.

The main users of this evaluation will be the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology, the NAO Support Unit, the Grant Beneficiaries and the EU Delegation to Malawi.
